Exploring flipped classroom pedagogies? Watch http://t.co/zHZRGKdWy4 by @S_J_Lancaster - practical, meaningful ideas for student LEARNING
@S_J_Lancaster great talk. Agree cam unnecessary (unless chalkboard), capture can't replace live experience, attendance issue not about cap
@S_J_Lancaster @VivienRolfe Indeed need to allow students time to process/formulate understanding both in and out of class through activity
@S_J_Lancaster @VivienRolfe Agree lecturer rather than lecture = inspiring! Flipped can't just shift lecture online. Careful design needed
@VivienRolfe @S_J_Lancaster lectures convey info in bulk, inspire, are social - the challenge is in enabling learning from them
@iwilsonysj @ARW276 @msars if a cap was only used by a few students, yet made a big diff to their understanding, is that such a bad thing?
@ARW276 @iwilsonysj @msars but when students do choose to watch them, they do value the contribution they make to private study
@ARW276 @iwilsonysj @msars not all lectures are re-watched by all students, many factors may affect choice over what to watch
@iwilsonysj @msars Students risk of being reclusive by getting all they need from captures during private study, reduces emails to lecturer
@DebbieHolley1 It appears you caught me doing my dance moves!
@dduret66 thanks. happy to discuss ideas further if you are also exploring lecture capture
@msars @ARW276 @iwilsonysj I may need a new group of students to answer that one...
